AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Laredo: destination to pick up commercial equipment
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Freer, Texas: location where an immigration checkpoint is situated and a stop occurred, also involved in a search of a tractor-trailer and prolonged stops, and where conflicting evidence about a Bluetooth was presented
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States: country where aliens entered or remained in violation of the law
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.district court: court that handles sentencing, reviews minor-role arguments, and makes findings regarding a defendant's level of involvement in offenses
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Supreme Court: recognized the constitutionality of suspicionless routine vehicle stops at immigration checkpoints
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.district court record: record of the case where ends-of-justice findings are set forth, includes events that occurred off the record
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.speedy trial case: case where speedy trial determinations are reviewed
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Speedy Trial Act: federal law regulating the time between indictment and trial
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Court of Appeals for the F: federal appeals court that has jurisdiction over cases from Texas and other states, and has ruled on matters related to smuggling and conspiracy
